title: Microsoft nearly overtakes Apple as most valuable company
text: A surge in Microsoft Corp's shares nearly unseated Apple Inc as the world's most valuable company on Wednesday, a day before the iPhone maker reports its quarterly results.

title: Microsoft's Cloud-Powered Q1 Results Prompt Analysts To Lift Price Target
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) shares rallied out of the gate Wednesday following the release of its quarterly results. The Microsoft Analysts: Stifel analyst Brad Reback maintained a Buy rating and increased the price target from $325 to $380.

title: Stock Market Today: Microsoft, Alphabet Carry Nasdaq to a Razor-Thin Gain
text: Two big performances from two mega-caps helped the Nasdaq just barely escape a close in the red Wednesday.

title: Wednesday Afternoon Analyst Upgrades and Downgrades: AMD, Capital One, Robinhood, Microsoft, Twitter and More
text: The broad markets pulled back from record levels on Wednesday afternoon. However, the Nasdaq was fairly higher on the day as a slew of strong-than-expected tech earnings have been driving the index.

title: Microsoft and Apple are neck and neck to be No. 1 in market value just ahead of the iPhone maker's earnings report
text: An additional 1% rally Microsoft stock, or a similar decline in Apple would mark the potential milestone.

title: Microsoft stock prediction after guiding FQ2 revenue above estimates
text: On Wednesday, Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) shares advanced after announcing its most recent quarterly results. The company reported its fiscal first-quarter 2022 revenue and earnings Tuesday after markets closed, beating the consensus for analyst expectations.

title: Alphabet and Microsoft rise to records after quarterly earnings beat estimates
text: Analysts applauded Microsoft for accelerating cloud growth in constant currency, and they liked that Google isn't getting hit hard by Apple privacy changes.

title: These 2 Trillion-Dollar Stocks Are Lighting Up the Nasdaq
text: These earnings reports will be must reads for investors.

title: Microsoft's (MSFT) Q1 Earnings & Revenues Surpass Estimates
text: Microsoft's (MSFT) fiscal first-quarter results reflect continued strength in the Azure cloud platform, Teams app and the gaming segment.

title: Microsoft Stock Remains a High Quality Tech Stock to Own
text: MSFT stock has bounced back recently. But the main appeal with investing in Microsoft is its status as a long-term, buy-and-hold opportunity.

title: What's Next For Microsoft Stock After Earnings Breakout?
text: Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ: MSFT) shares are trading higher Wednesday in the wake of the tech giant's first-quarter results.   Total company revenue rose almost 22% year-over-year and amounted to $45.32 billion.

title: ETFs to Tap As Cloud Powers Microsoft Fiscal Q1 Earnings
text: Microsoft (MSFT) continued a long track of beating earnings estimates and topped the revenue estimate driven by the demand for its software and cloud computing services for remote work and study.

title: Why Microsoft Shares Are Rising Today
text: Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ: MSFT) is trading higher after the company announced better-than-expected first-quarter fiscal 2022 financial results. Microsoft reported quarterly adjusted earnings of $2.27 per share, which beat the estimate of $2.07 per share.

title: Microsoft adds 23k employees in one year, growing 14% despite pandemic and tight labor market
text: Microsoft's global employee count grew to nearly 190,000 people at the end of the September quarter, a net increase of 23,500 people globally over the past year, or 14% year-over-year growth.

title: Microsoft Stock Notches Fresh Record After Earnings
text: Analysts are giving plenty of attention to Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) this morning, after the company's upbeat fiscal first-quarter earnings report.

title: Microsoft smashes through forecasts as cloud sales boom
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) racked up its best earnings performance since 2018 as business flocked to its Azure cloud-based computing arm. Azure and its other cloud services grew 50% over last year, said the tech titan, which helped propel revenues in the three months to end September, its first quarter, up by 22% to US$45.3bn and earnings by 48% to US$20.5bn.
